Class Errors

  • java.lang.Object
    • Errors

  • public class Errors
extends java.lang.Object
    Predefined messages for most semantic/typing errors. Helps providing automatic error evaluation. Each method here emits an error corresponding to the method name. Its parameters are useful for human readability. Error codes are used by the test scripts and are chosen arbitrarily.
    Author:
    aoliveir

      Constructor and Description
      Errors()

    • Method Detail

      • addExtra

        private static java.lang.String addExtra(java.lang.String extra)
        Auxiliary method to add extra information to the error message.
        Parameters:
        extra - extra information, or null if nothing should be added.
        Returns:
        an empty String if null, "(" + extra + )" otherwise.

      • unknownIdentifier

        public static void unknownIdentifier(org.antlr.runtime.tree.CommonTree token,
                     java.lang.String name,
                     java.lang.String extra)
        Error message for an unknown identifier (i.e., use before declaration).
        Parameters:
        token - ANTLR token (for line/column numbering).
        name - name of the undeclared identifier.
        extra - additional information to the error message, or null if none.

      • redefinedIdentifier

        public static void redefinedIdentifier(org.antlr.runtime.tree.CommonTree token,
                       java.lang.String name,
                       java.lang.String extra)
        Error message for a redefined identifier (e.g., two local variable declarations with same name).
        Parameters:
        token - ANTLR token (for line/column numbering).
        name - name of the redefined identifier.
        extra - additional information to the error message, or null if none.

      • incompatibleTypes

        public static void incompatibleTypes(org.antlr.runtime.tree.CommonTree token,
                     java.lang.Object expectedType,
                     java.lang.Object actualType,
                     java.lang.String extra)
        Error message for incompatible types (i.e., assignment of INT value to POINTER variable). Note that this uses a very broad definition of type incompatibility, i.e., several kinds of invalid operations can be mapped to a type incompatibility issue.
        Parameters:
        token - ANTLR token (for line/column numbering).
        expectedType - expected type (e.g., INT for a return value). Uses the toString() method of the object.
        actualType - actual obtained type (which is incompatible with the previous one). Uses the toString() method of the object.
        extra - additional information to the error message, or null if none.

      • miscError

        public static void miscError(org.antlr.runtime.tree.CommonTree token,
             java.lang.Object msg)
        Miscellaneous error message (for errors which do not fit any other method). Note: all "standard" errors should fit in one of the previous categories.
        Parameters:
        token - ANTLR token (for line/column numbering).
        msg - the entire error message describing the error.
